abstracts.cdata!:
The Natural Resource Management
            Project's objective is to establish the institutional
            and operational framework for sustainable, participatory
            management of Ghana's land and forest resources.  This
            environmental impact assessment identifies the impacts the
            project may have on biophysical and socio-economic
            environment and describes mitigative measures to reduce such
            impacts.  Wood processes could generate toxic chemicals
            which will cause air pollution.  These processes will
            require emission control.  Harvest activities may lead to
            soil compaction and rainfall runoff, and thus reduce
            groundwater recharge and increase flows of streams and
            rivers.  During harvesting operation, best practice
            guidelines will be followed to minimize the negative impacts
            on hydrology and water quality, and prevent soil erosion.
            Silvicultural techniques will regenerate new floral species
            removed from the forest because of plantation establishment.
            Plantations may also reduce biodiversity and cause a threat
            to wildlife now present on degraded sites. Forest management
            plans will be prepared to protect important wildlife
            habitats and identify the important biodiversity areas.
